segment.source: This section provides information about using Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) to manage your data-collection packages.
segment.target: This section provides information about using Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) to manage your data-collection packages.

segment.source: This section provides information about using Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) to manage your data-collection packages.
segment.target: This section provides information about using Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) to manage your data-collection packages.

segment.source: Data-collection packages include inventory-collector packages and runtime-analysis packages.
segment.target: Data-collection packages include inventory-collector packages and runtime-analysis packages.

segment.source: The following procedures apply to both package types.
segment.target: The following procedures apply to both package types.

segment.source: Log File Locations for Data-Collection Packages
segment.target: Log File Locations for Data-Collection Packages

segment.source: When you create a data-collection package in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can select an output location for your log files.
segment.target: When you create a data-collection package in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can select an output location for your log files.

segment.source: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can export a data-collection package as a Windows installer (.msi) file.
segment.target: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can export a data-collection package as a Windows installer (.msi) file.

segment.source: You can then use the .msi file to install the data-collection package on the computers from which you want to gather data.
segment.target: You can then use the .msi file to install the data-collection package on the computers from which you want to gather data.

segment.source: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can delete any of your existing data-collection packages from the database.
segment.target: In Application Compatibility Manager (ACM), you can delete any of your existing data-collection packages from the database.

segment.source: Application data and its associated compatibility issues can vary within an organization.
segment.target: Application data and its associated compatibility issues can vary within an organization.

segment.source: For example, the applications used by a Human Resources (HR) department might differ from the applications used by a Sales department.
segment.target: For example, the applications used by a Human Resources (HR) department might differ from the applications used by a Sales department.

segment.source: Even for applications that are used across an organization, different compatibility issues might be found for each business group because of the unique application use by each business group.
segment.target: Even for applications that are used across an organization, different compatibility issues might be found for each business group because of the unique application use by each business group.

segment.source: Testing Compatibility on the Target Platform
segment.target: Testing Compatibility on the Target Platform
